themes: temporary and self-imposed inaction for assessment
pressure to keep still so focus can arise (52–9 Concentration)
root-format fuel for the whole Understanding circuit
restlessness → depression when there is no focus
being the mountain: unshakable, calm, a steady field
fear: restless pressure with nothing to focus on

classical.hd_quote: The pause that is so profound that it leads to silence.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Uses stillness to prevent impulsive action; speaks or moves only when field is clear.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Speaks first, processes later → “energy that cannot be stilled.”

lines.group_role: initial stabilizer / mountain in the room

classical.hd_quote: The pause that is initiated to benefit others.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Uses its own inaction to keep others safe or to protect the situation.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Selfish pause that endangers others → “to selfishly restrain energy at the expense of others.”

classical.hd_quote: The ability by its very nature to understand restraint with the potential in acceptance, to use the period to redefine strategies.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Takes enforced downtime and actually improves the system; inaction becomes design time.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Deep dissatisfaction with controls → emotional withdrawal; pressure disturbs tranquillity.

classical.hd_quote: Perfected self-discipline and restraint that deals easily and wisely with impulsive temptations.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Shows others how to hold pressure without leaking energy.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Doubts the value of restraint → restlessness in the face of restraint.

classical.hd_quote: In times of inaction, the often important ability, to explain one's position.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Can tell the group exactly why it is pausing → maintains cohesion.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Too much inaction → loss of focus, not detail.

classical.hd_quote: A harmonic and balanced attunement that is at ease regardless of the situation.

interpretation.behavioral_axis: Embodies stillness so completely that pressure cannot disturb it.
interpretation.shadow_axis: Delusion as substitute for tranquillity; looks peaceful but is detached.

meta.provenance: classical.hd_title and classical.hd_quote taken verbatim (<25 words) from Ra Uru Hu’s The Complete Rave I’Ching / Line Companion text on Archive.org for “KEEPING STILL (MOUNTAIN) 52” lines 1–6 (L3475–L3446). Interpretations are original behavioral mappings for the user’s S³ schema.
